content.full_text:
Certification of Examination for Admittance of Stanislaus P. Lalumiere to the Practice

of Law, 12 February 18451
paragraphs: Certification of Examination for Admittance of Stanislaus P. Lalumiere to the Practice
citations: “An Act Concerning Attorneys and Counselors at Law,” 1 March 1833,Revised Laws of Illinois(1833), 99-102.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this certification. Joseph Gillespie signed his own
                  name.

2Aspiring lawyers inIllinoiswere required to pass an oral examination conducted by at least two attorneys.“An Act Concerning Attorneys and Counselors at Law,” 1 March 1833,Revised Laws of Illinois(1833), 99-102.

structured_content.text:
Certification of Examination  for Admittance of Stanislaus P. Lalumiere to the Practice
               of Law, 12 February 18451
